thread.title: The internet wants to know WTH Kellyanne Conway is doing on the Oval Office couch
thread.title_full: The internet wants to know WTH Kellyanne Conway is doing on the Oval Office couch

author: Keith Wagstaff
title: The internet wants to know WTH Kellyanne Conway is doing on the Oval Office couch
text:
Donald Trump had a big meeting with leaders of historically black colleges and obviously Kellyanne Conway took it very seriously.
What's happening here? The internet had opinions and theories. Lots of them.
I have so many questions about this photo, but chief among them is why nobody is telling Kellyanne Conway to get her damn feet off the couch pic.twitter.com/tU0CBS36Fe
— Rex Huppke (@RexHuppke) February 28, 2017
did no one's mama tell Kellyanne Conway to take her feet off that damn taxpayer-funded couch? pic.twitter.com/I2BiqNNgAS
— Mathew Rodriguez (@mathewrodriguez) February 28, 2017
Breaking news: Kellyanne Conway uses "alternative etiquette" by putting her feet on the couch of the Oval Office. pic.twitter.com/erb0KwyoBr
— Chris Arthur (@arthurct20) February 28, 2017
Kellyanne Conway on the couch pic.twitter.com/Wl33PwhuAP
— S A N D Y™ (@Sandy_Dover) February 28, 2017
Of course there were Tinder and Pokémon Go jokes.
If it's my profile you're looking at, @KellyannePolls , please swipe left. Thank you. pic.twitter.com/rHhc6jv4xN
— Jeff Hecht (@JeffHechtAZ) February 28, 2017
@anamariecox this ones my favorite pic.twitter.com/7AhCHsDhlE
— keith thornhill (@keiththornhill) February 28, 2017
Maybe the couch is trying to tell us something.
Zoom in on the couch pic.twitter.com/aiLh25TbIU
— #1 samir (@samir) February 28, 2017
Oh, here's the explanation.
Kellyanne Conway checks her phone after taking a photo of President Donald Trump and leaders of black universities, colleges in Oval Office pic.twitter.com/MgVhCoJFuC
— AFP news agency (@AFP) February 28, 2017
As people pointed out, former President Barack Obama was also photographed with his feet on the Oval Office furniture.
I'll take shoes on a couch over this any day. pic.twitter.com/JLE16uQFsF
— Amy Lutz (@amylutz4) February 28, 2017
But there are still reasons for concern. Apparently, the university presidents were hoping for a more substantial meeting with Education Secretary Betsy DeVos and other federal officials to talk about Pell Grants, according to Walter M. Kimbrough, president of Dillard University.
"That all blew up when the decision was made to take the presidents to the Oval Office to see the president," he wrote on Medium . "I’m still processing that entire experience. But needless to say that threw the day off and there was very little listening to HBCU presidents today ... "
So Trump got a photo op, Kellyanne got to kick her feet up, and college students got to continue to worry about debt. Sounds about right.
BONUS: Viola Davis is the first black woman to win an Emmy, Tony, and now, an Oscar for acting
